intro: Orbea anguinea, commonly known as the angular orbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Orbea anguinea is also noted for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic.
